ExcelFileReaderHelper¶

Last Modified on 7/31

class ExcelFileReaderHelper.ExcelFileReaderHelper¶

Bases: object

This class is responsible for reading from excel files, especially when it needs to read from multiple sheets This structure allows it to only bring the excel file into memory once, saving run time.

get_sheet(sheet_name, skip_first_row=True, use_cols='D:T', hard_col_name='HARDNESS', mod_col_name='MODULUS', x_col_name='X Position', y_col_name='Y Position', get_stiffness=False, stif_col_name='Stiffness', nulls=False)¶
Parameters

  • sheet_name – The name of the sheet to get from the excel document

  • skip_first_row – A boolean of whether or not to skip the first row of data being read

  • use_cols – The column range to read from

  • hard_col_name – The name of the column containing the hardness data

  • mod_col_name – The name of the column containing the modulus data

  • x_col_name – Name of the x values column

  • y_col_name – Name of the y values column

  • stif_col_name – Name of the stiffness column

  • get_stiffness – Boolean of whether or not to get the stiffness column

  • nulls –

Returns

A DataProcessingHelper that represents the excel sheet that is being read

Reads from the excel document already stored in memory, reading a single sheet. Returns a DataFrame containing the hardness values and a DataFrame containing the modulus values, in that order.

get_test_sheets()¶
Returns

Nothing

Finds all of the sheets in the data excel file that are meant to be used for data analysis. These sheets have always had the format of Test # Tagged or Test # thus far so we are just checking if the first four letters of the sheet are Test at the moment.

is_next_sheet()¶
Returns

True if there is another test sheet that can be read

Used as a way to check if there is another test sheet after the current test sheet that can be read

read_from_excel(file_path='data/1.16 um Radii Spherical Nanoindentation of 99.99 Percent CP Al.xlsx')¶
Parameters

file_path – The path to the excel file

Returns

Nothing

Method used to read from excel document, stores the entire excel document in memory

read_next_sheet(skip_first_row=True, use_cols='D:T', hard_col_name='HARDNESS', mod_col_name='MODULUS', x_col_name='X Position', y_col_name='Y Position', get_stiffness=False, stif_col_name='Stiffness', nulls=False)¶
Parameters

  • skip_first_row – A boolean of whether or not to skip the first row of data being read

  • use_cols – The column range to read from

  • hard_col_name – The name of the column containing the hardness data

  • mod_col_name – The name of the column containing the modulus data

  • x_col_name – Name of the x values column

  • y_col_name – Name of the y values column

  • get_stiffness – Boolean of whether or not to get the stiffness column

  • stif_col_name – Name of the stiffness column

  • nulls –

Returns

A DataProcessingHelper that represents the excel sheet that is being read

Reads from the excel document already stored in memory, reading a single sheet. Automated sheet reading is added into this process as well.

read_next_sheet_format1(nulls=False)¶
Returns

A DataProcessingHelper that represents the excel sheet that is being read

Parameters

nulls – Whether or not to include nulls in the data

Reads an excel sheet in the format of the sheets we were first given to use. These have the hardness column named as HARDNESS and modulus as MODULUS.

read_next_sheet_format2(get_stiffness=False, nulls=False)¶
Parameters

  • get_stiffness – Boolean of whether or not to get the stiffness column

  • nulls – Whether or not to include nulls in the data

Returns

A DataProcessingHelper that represents the excel sheet that is being read

Reads an excel sheet in the format of the sheets we were given that has three phases and was given around 8/3/20.
